medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe ophthalmological manifestations including photophobia and hemeralopia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with recurrent episodes of confusion with hyperammonemia at age 23 while on a protein-restricted diet. Symptoms included mild intellectual delay and brisk tendon reflexes. Photophobia and hemeralopia prompted an ophthalmological evaluation, which showed a marked reduction of visual acuity, cataract presence, and worsening of retinal degeneration over one year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of Hyperornithinemia-Hyperammonemia-Homocitrullinuria (HHH) syndrome, confirmed by the presence of a homozygous p.R275Q mutation in SLC25A15, and previous episodes of hepatitic-like attacks with moderate hyperammonemia.
medical_history.family_history: Family history was unremarkable for hemeralopia; fundoscopy of parents and sister was normal.
